alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Hamilton; Meigs; Rhea; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 10:18AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CDT/215 PM EDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Bledsoe, Hamilton, Meigs, Rhea and Sequatchie. * WHEN...Until 115 PM CDT /215 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1016 AM CDT /1116 AM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms during the past hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain is estimated to have fallen in the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over parts of the area in the next couple hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dayton, Pikeville, Soddy-Daisy, Graysville, Brayton, Sale Creek, Mount Crest, Evensville, Palio, Flat Top Mountain, Old Washington, Old Cumberland and Fall Creek Falls State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
